question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: It would have been nice to see our team's work be reflected in real-world solutions throughout the semesters, however, that did not align with the project's timeline.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The weekly systematic review deadlines and the self-learning of ReactJS

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Instead of learning about theories we literally do research and this is great.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This bass team is very intricate and would likely only be appreciated by those who are intrinsically motivated by neuroscience and global health research.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This is a very interesting bass connections project, and if you have interests in health and alcohol use disorders, then this would be a good fit for you. The systematic review is the most time-consuming part of the class, but at the same time, I enjoyed doing it and reading about studies relating to DSM disorders. Everyone on the team is learning together, so it is not exactly the same type of environment as a discussion or a lecture type of class.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Definitely apply for this if you want to get involved in a big research project and know people also interested in this.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: When you are considering crediting the course, expect to do a lot of work outside of your subteam. Sometimes, your subteam's work is also covers other subteams' tasks, so be prepared for that.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: making research poster, presenting research poster, how to conduct and analyze focus groups

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Before joining the team, I was unaware of the struggles of individuals with serious mental illness, and I was also unfamiliar with how their treatment may or may not serve them. I learned a lot about the development process of a research project, from coming up with an idea to conducting focus groups and analyzing findings. I really enjoyed seeing it all come together throughout the year. I appreciated this opportunity as an introductory research experience, and I especially enjoyed the coding portion of the semester.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to do qualitative coding, how to not assume what a "typical" daily sensory experience is, and how severe mental illness influence sensory health.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1. I learned much about sensory health and its importance for everyday living. 
2. What independent versus successful living looks like for different people 
3. How qualitative analysis and research are conducted.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: qualitative coding, interview research, OT

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned more about what sensory health and living skills, and what obstacles adults living with serious mental illness in the community faces. I also learned how to run focus groups/interviews.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The topic of adults with SMI is one that requires a lot of attention, care, and intention, so I think by having to learn about their varying experiences, I was automatically intellectually stimulated. It also helped that most of the content was new to me, so I learned something new every class.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I think the focus groups we did and extensive research into existing literature made this class super interesting.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I learned a lot about research methods, the logistics behind planning and recruiting. Additionally, because I came in with a limited knowledge of what sensory health actually was, I learned a lot just through the discussions and activities we had and did during our meetings.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: the instructors were very excited about the topic

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: good intro to qualitative research and connects research to psychology, science, sociology, OT, etc.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Bass Connections is a real research experience, and with that comes real research challenges. However, there's a lot of value in being a part of the research process (especially if it's new to you or something you're interested in), so fully immerse yourself and embrace it. Antoine and MaryBeth are great, and the topic is very interesting.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: DO BASS CONNECTIONS! It's been so great to learn in an out-of-classroom manner and it opens your eyes to so many unique human experiences.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
